kbs.name: Idolaf Battle-Born
kbs.description: a man, giving quest via "Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born"

kbs.name: "Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born"
kbs.description: a letter to the player from Idolaf Battle-Born

plots: Idolaf Battle-Born saw the player assault Nazeem

quest.title: Scare My Enemy
quest.objective: assault someone for Idolaf Battle-Born
quest.description:
Letter from Idolaf Battle-Born
by Idolaf Battle-Born

Dragonborn,
I'm aware of your recent assault on Nazeem. Rest assured I have no interest in that particular matter. I do, however, have an interest in your willingness to employ force when the need arises.
If you are able to assist me, I will gladly pay you for your troubles.
Next time you are visiting Whiterun, please call on me.
Sincerely, Idolaf Battle-Born

kbs.name: First Edition
kbs.description: a famous bookshop far away from Solstheim

kbs.name: Strident Squall
kbs.description: a ship that sank off the coast of Solstheim, and turned into a reaver den

plots: Cindiri Arano sent the Folio to the First Edition to be rebound: they sent it back on the Strident Squall

quest.title: First Edition
quest.objective: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
tasks: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
quest.description:
A few months ago, I had sent an important Folio to the First Edition to be rebound. They sent it back to me recently, but it never arrived.
The Folio was aboard the "Strident Squall" or something like that. The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine? One of the sailors survived. Poor thing crawled all the way to Raven Rock on his hands and knees. Before he died, he told the guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Could you find the Folio for me? You have no idea how much it hurts losing such a precious item!

plots: Nathan and his friends disappeared some days ago

quest.title: Farmer Brun's Missing Son
quest.objective: find Nathan
quest.description:
I beseech thee, kind soul, please help.
I'm farmer Brun. It's strange happenings at my farm, and I've not the strength I once had. I've nothing to offer, and even if I did I doubt such as you would have need of it. My son Nathan and his friends went looking for our missing cattle, then they just up and disappeared! Been gone for days now and, with all the bandits around, who knows what's happened. I don't know where they were heading, but I saw some sort o' tracks to the west.
Please find Nathan. I can't afford to keep the farm without my son.

kbs.name: Ghorak
relations: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

kbs.name: The Lady's Hall
relations: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

kbs.name: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
kbs.description: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

kbs.name: Kereph
relations: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

plots: Ghorak was cursed with an illness for killing his brother
Agnasia knows how to cure Ghorak

quest.title: Ghorak the Diseased
quest.objective: take Kereph's skull to Agnasia
tasks: Make your way to behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs.
quest.description:
For your own health and that of your children, come no closer.
I, Ghorak, was cursed with this fell disease as punishment for my wickedness... No, your potions and magics are of little use. The only way to cure this sickness is to right the wrongs of the past. Behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs, you will find the skull of my brother, Kereph. Take it to Agnasia in The Lady's Hall. She will know what to do with it.

kbs.name: Professor Stoker
relations: next to the entrance to the Broken Mines

kbs.name: next to the entrance to the Broken Mines
kbs.description: next to the entrance to the Broken Mines

plots: the Alchemist went into the Broken Mines: he is nearing his goal

quest.title: On the Alchemist's Trail
quest.objective: stop the Alchemist
quest.description:
This is the only entrance to the Broken Mines that we've found, so the Alchemist is almost certainly in there. That probably means he's near his goal, whatever that is... and that means he'll do everything he can to keep you from stopping him. He'll be even more desperate, more dangerous.
I don't know what we'll encounter in there.

kbs.name: Keldorn
kbs.description: a betrayed man, and the player's friend

kbs.name: Mithrest
kbs.description: an inn in the Promenade District of Athkatla

kbs.name: Sir William of Thorpe
kbs.description: a foreign noble, and a good man

plots: Keldorn's wife has been seeing Sir William of Thorpe
Sir William of Thorpe has challenged Keldorn's honor

quest.title: Adulterer's lot
quest.objective: bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe
tasks: go find Sir William of Thorpe with Keldorn
bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe
quest.description:
My wife has been seeing another man. Sir William of Thorpe... He's a foreign noble establishing trade here in Athkatla. He was a good man — at least I always thought so until... until now.
My friend, let us bestow some justice. Sir William has challenged my honor. There must be a reprisal.
We must make haste to the Mithrest in the Promenade District. I cannot live like this for long.

kbs.name: Shrine of Kynareth
kbs.description: west of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest

plots: Sir Juncan died while seeking out the Boots of the Crusader

quest.title: Nature's Fury
quest.objective: retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: talk to the priests of Kynareth
retrieve the Boots of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
My name was Sir Juncan.
I wish to see you succeed where I failed. I was on the path to the Boots of the Crusader, but died before I reached them.
I cannot tell you exactly how to find the Boots, for that will be up to Kynareth. I can tell you to seek out her Priests, though. West of the Imperial City, on the edge of the Great Forest, is a shrine. You will find them there, and they will tell you what you need to know.

plots: Malaaq was bound to guard Irenicus' items and the player's weapon
Malaaq was captured from his home, Plane of Air, by Irenicus
Malaaq will be free if he is given his original flask

quest.title: Free the Genie
quest.objective: return Malaaq's flask to him
quest.description:
I am djinni Malaaq and I have been bound by a wizard to guard his items, and your item it seems. I can sense your touch upon this weapon.
If you can secure the means of my release, I will give you your weapon.
I was captured in my home, on Plane of Air, by some wizard. He bound me to this flask that I might guard his things. You must find my original flask and bring it back to me. Once it is within my grasp, I can break the enchantment and be freed.

plots: Shadr thinks that Sapphire cheated him: Shadr ordered a shipment from the Whiterun stables, it never came

quest.title: Stabilized
quest.objective: help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
tasks: talk with Sapphire about Shadr's debt
help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
quest.description:
I owe a great deal of money to someone and I think they cheated me. I don't know what to do.
I was able to work out a deal with the stables in Whiterun to sell me some of their tack and harnesses. I borrowed some gold from Sapphire to pay for the shipment, but it got robbed before it even arrived. Now Sapphire wants her money back, and if I don't pay her, I think she's going to kill me.
Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.

plots: the player asked mysticism training from Dagail

quest.title: Mysticism Training
quest.objective: strengthen the barriers between the worlds
tasks: strengthen the barriers between the worlds
quest.description:
Training, child? You would know more about the mystic energies of the world around us?
The barriers between planes are weak. Do more to strengthen them; seal the portals to Oblivion. Then we shall speak of training.

kbs.name: Brielbara
kbs.description: a female mage of minor power

kbs.name: Namara
kbs.description: a baby and Brielbara's only daughter

plots: Yago has cursed Namara: Brielbara can undo the curse with Yago's spellbook

quest.title: Brielbara's Baby
quest.objective: bring Yago's spellbook to Brielbara
quest.description:
Travelers! I am Brielbara, a mage of minor power.
I'll pay you 200 gold, not much for heroic adventurers, but all that I have.
An evil mage has laid a curse upon my only child, Namara. She is slowly wasting away and, without help, she'll die. The mage who did this is named Yago, and I'm sure that he possesses the remedy to the curse. Would you track him down for me, please? He's been staying at a place called the Low Lantern. It's the playground for the wicked and depraved, a ship where prostitutes ply their trade. All I want you to do is find him and take his spellbook. I have enough magical skill to reverse the curse if I had the formula for his spell.

kbs.name: Ocheeva
kbs.description: the player's superior at the Dark Brotherhood

kbs.name: Adamus Phillida
kbs.description: a recently retired Imperial Legion officer who spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, and a powerful man
relations: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks

kbs.name: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks
kbs.description: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks

kbs.name: Rose of Sithis
kbs.description: a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target, cannot pierce armor

plots: the Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida

quest.title: Permanent Retirement
quest.objective: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
tasks: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
quest.description:
I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours.

kbs.name: Slavers' Camp
kbs.description: home of the slavers who have been harassing the Estherians, in the Frosted Hills

plots: the player freed Elder Josimon from the slavers: he had recovered the Passkey Ember from them, but they captured him

quest.title: Up In Smoke
quest.objective: put the slavers out of the picture for good
tasks: put the slavers out of the picture for good
quest.description:
Thank you for rescuing me. I had recovered the Passkey Ember from these slavers, but they captured me as I was trying to return to the Enclave.
I could use your help with one small matter before you go. These slavers have been harrying the Estherians for several weeks now. You defeated many, but there are many more watching us from the safety of those huts. Burn them out! If they are allowed to remain, the Frosted Hills will never be safe.

plots: Narcissos wants comfort
the player is not wearing any kind of armor

quest.title: A Fancy New Shirt
quest.objective: give a leather tunic to Narcissos
tasks: give a leather tunic to Narcissos
quest.description:
Aren't I just the handsomest man in this village? I'd like to become even flashier than I am now.
Even you, traveler, lack any kind of flashy armor. I could give you my old, crummy diamond chestplate so that you'd look a bit less embarrassing.
However, I want you to give me a brand new leather tunic in return.

plots: the player is presenting an ancient Falmer tome to Urag gro-Shub and asking if Urag gro-Shub is interested in buying it

quest.title: Forgotten Books
quest.objective: bring ancient Falmer tomes to Urag gro-Shub
tasks: bring ancient Falmer tomes to Urag gro-Shub
quest.description:
Well, well. I haven't seen one of these beauties in a long time. A rare find in the original Falmer language. You're damn right I'm interested. Question is, are you selling?
Well, considering no one else in Skyrim would buy something they couldn't possibly read, I'd say you don't have much of a choice. Tell you what, you bring me books like this, and I'll pay a thousand gold each. I'll even throw in a translated edition I have for free.
If you're holding out for more gold, it's never going to happen.

kbs.name: Calcelmo
kbs.description: a stressful man, and the most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel

plots: the player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research

quest.title: Nimhe, the Poisoned One
quest.objective: kill Nimhe
quest.description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

kbs.name: Valus Odiil
kbs.description: an old warrior turned farmer, and a worried father

kbs.name: Odiil Farm
kbs.description: Valus Odiil, Rallus and Antus' farm, not far from Chorrol

plots: Rallus may know more about the creatures that attacked the Odiil Farm

quest.title: The Killing Field
quest.objective: reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
tasks: meet up with Rallus and Antus
reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
quest.description:
My sons! Have you seen my sons Rallus and Antus? They're going to fight off the creatures at our farm, but I fear for their safety.
For the last few days, we've suffered attacks from these creatures at our farm not far from Chorrol. They're coming from someplace in the Great Forest. I don't know where, but Rallus may know more by now. My boys will take up the fight even if the guards won't. Doesn't matter if it's outside the town walls - it still affects us all. They expect me to go with them, but... I fear in my old age, I'm not the warrior I once was. Would you... would you go in my place?
I'm supposed to meet them at Weynon Priory. You'd best get whatever supplies you need now, so you can get there in time.
I... I need a drink to calm my nerves. Please, excuse me.

kbs.name: Pelinal Whitestrake
kbs.description: a legendary male knight of old

plots: knights who wished to quest for the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake would walk the Pilgrim's Way: the player should pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon the player's quest

quest.title: Pilgrimage
quest.objective: show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake
tasks: Find your way to Wayshrines of the Nine Divines.
complete the Pilgrimage of the Nine Divines
show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake
quest.description:
Oh my. To what do I owe this honor? I am but a humble prophet. What business do you have with me?
You would quest for the holy panoply of Pelinal Whitestrake? The legendary Relics that have been sought by mighty warriors throughout the ages? Are you a worthy knight?
The gods grant insight to those they deem worthy. Why and how they act is not predictable. What I can tell you is that traditionally, knights who wished to quest for the Relics would walk the Pilgrim's Way.
Travel to the Wayshrines of the Nine Divines. Pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon your quest.

kbs.name: Cyrodiil
kbs.description: a province half a continent away from the player and Serana

kbs.name: Elder Scrolls
kbs.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

plots: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls

quest.title: Prophet
quest.objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
tasks: ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls
find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
quest.description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

kbs.name: Neloth
relations: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

kbs.name: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim
kbs.description: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

plots: Briarhearts remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds, putting their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces

quest.title: Briarheart Necropsy
quest.objective: examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
tasks: Travel to the hills on the western edge of Skyrim.
examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
quest.description:
I've been having difficulties with my heart stone experiments.
Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference.

kbs.name: Raminus Polus
kbs.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild
relations: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

kbs.name: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave
kbs.description: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

kbs.name: Zahrasha
relations: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

kbs.name: Eletta
relations: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave

plots: several mages tend the grove

quest.title: A Mage's Staff
quest.objective: complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff
tasks: Arrive at the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave.
speak to Zahrasha or Eletta, and choose wisely
complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff
quest.description:
Before you can begin work for the guild, you'll need to do something for yourself. Every mage carries a staff. It is crafted and enchanted by the guild, and is a symbol of status. You need such a staff.
The wood used for staves comes from a grove to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave. Several mages tend to the grove, and should be able to assist you. Speak with either Zahrasha or Eletta when you arrive.
And choose wisely.

plots: Jaheira kept the player waiting as there were things she had to take care of
Jaheira was asked to bring the player to the Harper Hold

quest.title: Summoned to the Harper Hold
quest.objective: see the Harpers with Jaheira
tasks: Travel to Harper Hold in Athkatla.
quest.description:
Hail there! I said I would return, and I have. Sorry to have kept you waiting, but there were things I had to take care of. Now that we have met once again, there is something I must ask of you.
We must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you.

kbs.name: Orthorn
kbs.description: an ex-student of the College of Winterhold

plots: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep

quest.title: Hitting the Books
quest.objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
tasks: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
quest.description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

kbs.name: Olyn Seran
kbs.description: a worshiper of Molag Bal, and a master Conjurer

kbs.name: Molag Bal
kbs.description: the prince of domination, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player asked Olyn Seran to train them  in Conjuration

quest.title: Conjuration Training
quest.objective: prove Olyn Seran that you are worthy of his teachings
tasks: Go to a shrine to Molag Bal.
summon a Faded Wraith right here, before Olyn Seran
prove Olyn Seran that you are worthy of his teachings
quest.description:
You would seek Conjuration training from me? Well, then my request is small. Prove to me that you are capable of serving Molag Bal in your own way.
Summon a Faded Wraith right here, before me. When I have seen it with my own eyes, you shall be worthy of my teachings.

kbs.name: Fura Bloodmouth
relations: an abandoned fort in the Reach

kbs.name: an abandoned fort in the Reach
kbs.description: an abandoned fort in the Reach

plots: the Dawnguard will become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered

quest.title: Destroying the Dawnguard
quest.objective: prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
tasks: Travel to an abandoned fort in the Reach.
prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
quest.description:
The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us. They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach. The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike. Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it. Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.

kbs.name: Lenne
kbs.description: a forefather of Roggi Knot-Beard who lost the Knot-Beard shield

plots: Roggi Knot-Beard's clan was one of the first to settle Kynesgrove: Lenne was the first to discover the mines

quest.title: Roggi's Family Shield
quest.objective: retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
tasks: retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
quest.description:
I'm from from here. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead. Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
According to my grandfather at least, the family shield should be in the cave. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into: Ansilvund. Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.

plots: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord

quest.title: Unbound
quest.objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
quest.description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

kbs.name: William Reirrac
kbs.description: a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

kbs.name: a neutral meeting place
kbs.description: a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale

plots: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Metrich wants some squatters removed from his lands: the squatters used violence against Metrich's men

quest.title: Dealing with the Baron
quest.objective: restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute
tasks: Make your way to a neutral meeting place.
restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute
quest.description:
Knight, we have been commissioned by a local barony. Such service to political figures is good for the Order, and you will serve quite well in the task.
It is necessary for us to be accessible in local concerns lest we seem above the people. In this case, a baron has petitioned us to solve a land dispute. Baron Metrich wishes some squatters removed and has cited violence against his men as reason for it. Go to his lands, restore order, and bring favor to us.
The baron waits in a neutral meeting place. He is in a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale. Go now.

kbs.name: Vilkas
kbs.description: a fellow member of the Companions

kbs.name: Jorrvaskr
kbs.description: the mead hall of the Companions

kbs.name: Driftshade Refuge
kbs.description: the headquarters of the Silver Hand

kbs.name: Kodlak
kbs.description: an old man, and the leader of the Companions

plots: the Silver Hand attacked the Companions in Jorrvaskr, killed Kodlak, and stole the fragments of Wuuthrad

quest.title: Purity of Revenge
quest.objective: avenge Kodlak
tasks: retrieve the fragments of Wuuthrad and wipe out the Silver Hand
quest.description:
The Silver Hand attacked us. They finally found enough courage to attack Jorrvaskr. We fought them off, but... The old man... Kodlak... he's dead.
No one else got hurt, but they made off with all our fragments of Wuuthrad. But you and I are going to reclaim them. We will bring the battle to their chief camp, Driftshade Refuge. There will be none left living to tell their stories. Only songs of Jorrvaskr will be sung.
We will avenge Kodlak. And they will know terror before the end.

plots: the corrupt watchman took Ruslan's last septim
Luronk and Ruslan were shopping at Jensine's when the corrupt watchman accused them of stealing: the corrupt watchman fined Luronk and Ruslan even though Jensine said that they were innocent
the corrupt watchman has shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District

quest.title: Imperial Corruption
quest.objective: do something about the corrupt watchman
tasks: ask around about the corrupt watchman
do something about the corrupt watchman
quest.description:
Hey stranger, can you spare a few coins? I've just been shaken down by that bastard watchman and he took my last septim. I don't know his name, but I'd recognize him if I saw him again.
Luronk and I were shopping at Jensine's when he accused us of stealing. Even Jensine said we were innocent, but he didn't care. We had to pay his "fine" or go to jail.
He's shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District. They're all too afraid of him to do anything. Jensine wouldn't even talk about it.
Someone ought to do something about him.

kbs.name: Sickly Bernice
kbs.description: a sickly woman, and the proprietor

kbs.name: Aquanostrum
kbs.description: a liquid cure that bubbles up from around an old statue

plots: Sickly Bernice thinks these may be her last days in the Shivering Isles
on the lowest level of the Knotty Bramble, there is a pool containing Aquanostrum: Sickly Bernice gives the player a special flask to collect the Aquanostrum

quest.title: A Liquid Solution
quest.objective: bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice
tasks: find Aquanostrum to cure Sickly Bernice's illness
quest.description:
Oh... hello. Sickly Bernice, proprietor. Don't get too close now. You might catch what I have.
Well... it seems I am dying. Yes, these may be my last days in the Shivering Isles. That is, unless someone like yourself could help me find the cure. But no one has taken me up on my offer, even with the promise of a reward. Ah well, it's been a good life I suppose....
There's only one place in all the Isles to get the cure for what I have... Knotty Bramble. I'll mark it on your map. There, on the lowest level of the place, is a pool containing the cure: Aquanostrum. Legend has it that it bubbles up from around an old statue. Bring me back the remedy, and I will reward you well with a Circlet of Verdure. Here, take this special flask to collect the Aquanostrum.

kbs.description: notes on the discovery of the Thing

plots: the Thing got in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared

quest.title: The Thing
quest.objective: destroy the Thing before it infects the whole world
tasks: destroy the Thing before it infects the whole world
quest.description:
"Blair's Notes"
by Blair

It was in the ice. Who knows how long? But it wasn't dead. And now it's hiding, here somewhere... in one of us. We found it in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared. It's still here, and it's looking for a way out. If it gets out into the world, it can infect everyone, everywhere. Three years, at most. Gods forgive us for what we've set loose upon the world.

Mister Meek has heard that the player help people

quest.title: Fleeting Strength
quest.objective: give a Potion of Strength to Mister Meek
tasks: give a Potion of Strength to Mister Meek
quest.description:
You're the one who's been helping people, right? Well, now you could help me too.
You see, I need to get my hands on a Potion of Strength. I'm not the strongest person around: for once, I'd like to carry things around as if they were mere feathers.
Give me the potion, and receive a precious diamond in return.

quest.description:
Would you learn from me? Then meet me during the day, out under the waves in the bay.
If you wish to learn what I know about Alteration, then you must stay there with me for a full three hours. How you manage to do this is up to you; do not wander off, or I shall consider this test of your ability failed.

there are important documents in the chest here

quest.title: A Hidden Base in the Cloakwood
quest.objective: investigate Tazok and his group of bandits
tasks: investigate Tazok and his group of bandits
quest.description:
This whole thing is dirty to the core, that's what I know! These aren't your ordinary bandits here. Tazok's been making regular visits to the Cloakwood, so that's where I'd start if I were you. There are some documents in that chest that might be worth taking a look at, too.
Now go step on some toes, all right? And you can tell them Ender Sai sent you.

kbs.description: an orphaned dark elf who was raised by Argonians in the Black Marsh

kbs.description: the land of the dark elves

plots: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni

quest.title: Distant Memories
quest.objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
quest.description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

quest.title: Return to the Enclave
quest.objective: stop the Alchemist before he can drain the two Guardians in the Ossean Wastes
tasks: talk to Commander Vale about getting to the Ossean Wastes
stop the Alchemist before he can drain the two Guardians in the Ossean Wastes
quest.description:
I fear the Alchemist is a pawn of the Netherim. With the power of the Guardians, a portal to the Nether Realm could be thrown wide, and the world would be plunged into an age of never-ending torment.
Return to the Enclave immediately. Commander Vale can help you secure passage to the Ossean Wastes, where two of my fellow Guardians can be found. Stop the Alchemist before he can drain them as well!

quest.title: Jewel of the Desert
quest.objective: build an inn in Desert Refuge
tasks: gather up materials for building an inn
build an inn in Desert Refuge
quest.description:
Hail traveler! I'd guide you toward a soft bed, but as it happens, our village doesn't have an inn.
We really could use an inn: travelers heading in and out of the desert pass by Desert Refuge often. An inn would make our village even more famous! Could you build an inn here? You just need some building materials; I'll give you a box of materials to start with.
We will give you ten stacks of sand as a reward, to help you craft many useful things.

quest.title: Keeping Up the Appearances
quest.objective: give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
tasks: steal Nelacar's mage's staff from his room
give Nelacar's mage's staff to Malur Seloth
quest.description:
I do nothing around here. And I hope to keep it that way. The Jarl is convinced I have some connection with the College, so he goes easy on me.
Maybe you'd like to help me keep up appearances? Old Nelacar has a mage's staff in his room in the Frozen Hearth. It'd be good to have that staff in case the Jarl starts wondering if I actually have a real connection to the College.
Pinch that staff for me. I'll be waiting for it. Once I have it, I'll show you a few tricks I've learned about buttering up royalty.
